title: (x) What Typeface? / sans - FS Albert Extrabold {Simon D}
content:
Can someone let me know what typeface this is?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 4.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018224737/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%204_76.png) | 9.57 KB |
author: animal

comments.content: These are definitely Helvetica bold shapes, but there being so many different versions of Helvetica and its derivatives I'm having trouble finding an exact match. Maybe it is Nimbus Sans L Bold with some Illustrator-type outlining in black.
Looks like FS Albert to me

Brian, definitely Helvetica?  
Are you sure you looked at the right sample?

I think I might have been looking at the wrong picture sample, a photo of a sign saying "Georgia" in outlined letters. Now when I click the link again I see a simple black-and-white sample of "could", which does look like FS Albert. Maybe it was some cache problem. Sorry for the confusion.

This was the sample I was looking at: [http://typophile.com/files/IMAG0081.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018224737/http:/typophile.com/files/IMAG0081.jpg)

My mistake.
